title: Taonga – A Tribal Response to Museums

PRINCIPLE I:The Right to Advise The Auckland War Memorial Museum Act 1996 empowers the Taumata-a-Iwi to give advice on all matters of Maori protocol within the Museum and between the Museum and Maori people at large

Museum policies will reflect the aspirations of both Treaty partners by acknowledging that existing and proposed policies (section 16(8)) will be reviewed by the Taumata-a-Iwi and recommendations to the Auckland Museum Trust Board will be made accordingly
